indications.text: enoxaparin sodium injection low molecular weight heparin ( lmwh ) indicated : prophylaxis deep vein thrombosis ( dvt ) abdominal surgery , hip replacement surgery , knee replacement surgery , medical patients severely restricted mobility acute illness ( 1.1 ) inpatient treatment acute dvt without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) outpatient treatment acute dvt without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) prophylaxis ischemic complications unstable angina non-q-wave myocardial infarction ( myocardial infarction ) ( 1.3 ) treatment acute st-segment elevation myocardial infarction ( stemi ) managed medically subsequent percutaneous coronary intervention ( pci ) ( 1.4 )

warningsAndPrecautions: enoxaparin sodium injection , usp clear , colorless pale yellow solution supplied follows : 100 mg per ml concentration * strength represents number milligrams enoxaparin sodium water injection . †approximate anti-factor xa activity based reference w.h.o . first international low molecular weight heparin reference standard . §each enoxaparin sodium injection , usp multi-dose vial contains 15 mg benzyl alcohol per 1 ml preservative . ndc strength * anti-xa activity † label color package factor 68001-641-41 300 mg per 3 ml multi-dose vial § 30,000 iu red 1 vial per carton store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature . ] store original carton packaging ready . store multi-dose vials 28 days first . sterile , nonpyrogenic . container closure made natural rubber latex .
adverseReactions: enoxaparin sodium contraindicated patients : active major bleeding history immune-mediated heparin-induced thrombocytopenia ( hit ) within past 100 days presence circulating antibodies [ ( 5.4 ) ] known hypersensitivity enoxaparin sodium ( e.g . , pruritus , urticaria , anaphylactic/anaphylactoid ) [ ( 6.2 ) ] known hypersensitivity heparin pork products known hypersensitivity benzyl alcohol [ ( 5.8 ) ]
name: Enoxaparin Sodium
indications_original: Enoxaparin Sodium Injection is a low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) indicated for: Prophylaxis of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in abdominal surgery, hip replacement surgery, knee replacement surgery, or medical patients with severely restricted mobility during acute illness ( 1.1 ) Inpatient treatment of acute DVT with or without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) Outpatient treatment of acute DVT without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) Prophylaxis of ischemic complications of unstable angina and non-Q-wave myocardial infarction (MI) ( 1.3 ) Treatment of acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) managed medically or with subsequent percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) ( 1.4 )
contraindications_original: See full prescribing information for dosing and administration information. ( 2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Enoxaparin Sodium Injection, USP is a clear, colorless to pale yellow solution and is supplied as follows:
                  
                     100 mg per mL Concentration
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           * Strength represents the number of milligrams of enoxaparin sodium in Water for Injection.
                        
                        
                           
                              †Approximate anti-Factor Xa activity based on reference to the W.H.O. First International Low Molecular Weight Heparin Reference Standard.
   
    
                        
                        
                           
                              §Each Enoxaparin Sodium Injection, USP multi-dose vial contains 15 mg benzyl alcohol per 1 mL as a preservative.

                              300 mg per 3 mL Multi-Dose Vial
     
      §
                              
                           
                           
                              30,000 IU
                           
                           
                              Red
                           
                           
                              1 vial per carton
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.] Store in the original carton or packaging until ready to use.
                  Do not store the multi-dose vials for more than 28 days after the first use.
                  
                     Sterile, Nonpyrogenic.
                  
                  
                     The container closure is not made with natural rubber latex.
adverseReactions_original:
Enoxaparin sodium is contraindicated in patients with:
                  
                     Active major bleeding
                     History of immune-mediated heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) within the past 100 days or in the presence of circulating antibodies
  
   [see Warnings and Precautions (
   
    5.4)]
  
   
                     
                     Known hypersensitivity to enoxaparin sodium (e.g., pruritus, urticaria, anaphylactic/anaphylactoid reactions)
  
   [see Adverse Reactions (
   
    6.2)]
  
   
                     
                     Known hypersensitivity to heparin or pork products
                     Known hypersensitivity to benzyl alcohol
  
   [see Warnings and Precautions (
   
    5.8)]
